Table of contents

Commands for the Monte Carlo

Sweep length, temperature etc.

  • --steps_per_cycle or -lcyc : Number of elementary Monte Carlo steps in a Monte Carlo cycle or sweep. The default length of a sweep in ProFASi v. 1.5 is the number of degrees of freedom in the system.
  • --temperature or -T : Temperature for the MC run. You can specify the temperature in Kelvin: -T "300 Kelvin". If no unit is given, it is assumed that the temperature is in ProFASi's internal units, like in: -T 0.5.

Conformational updates

  • --update_prob_file or -upfile : Name of the file with probabilities for various updates. The format for update probability specification is described in updateprob.
  • --config_update or -cup : Configure updates using information in an XML file. See XML configuration file for updates for details.

There are also switches for each conformational update, Pivot, BGS, Rot, Rotation and Translation. To turn off Pivot for a simulation, use for example, --no-Pivot. To force the use of rigid body updates in single chain simulations, you can use the switches --Rotation --Translation. To specify a switch in the settings file, you write, for instance, "Rotation on".
